message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how to reproduce the pictured “house” exactly from the blocks shown:

1)  Analysis of the Main Target Image

•  Total Block Count and Layers  
   –  There are seven total blocks used.  
   –  From bottom to top, the structure has four “layers”:  
      1) Two tall green pillars on the ground.  
      2) One yellow rectangular beam laid across the tops of the green pillars.  
      3) A red arch block centered on the yellow beam, with a red rectangular block stacked atop the arch.  
      4) Two orange triangular wedges forming a pitched roof.

•  Spatial Relationships  
   –  The two green pillars stand parallel to each other with a gap.  
   –  The yellow beam spans (bridges) from the top of one green pillar to the other.  
   –  The red arch is centered on the yellow beam, and the rectangular red block sits directly on the arch.  
   –  The two orange wedges meet along their long edges to form the ridged roof at the top.

2)  Selecting the Required Blocks from the Dictionary

•  Needed Blocks and Indices  
   –  Green pillars (2×): index 5 (tall vertical green block), used twice.  
   –  Yellow beam (1×): index 8 (long horizontal yellow block).  
   –  Red arch (1×): index 1 (arch facing forward).  
   –  Red rectangular block (1×): index 11 (oriented left‐to‐right).  
   –  Orange roof wedges (2×): indices 13 and 14 (placed side by side to form the pitched roof).

3)  Suggested Assembly Order

{
  Step1: Move block with index 5   (place the first green pillar)  
  Step2: Move block with index 5   (place the second green pillar)  
  Step3: Move block with index 8   (span the yellow beam across the green pillars)  
  Step4: Move block with index 1   (center the red arch on top of the yellow beam)  
  Step5: Move block with index 11  (stack the red rectangular block on the arch)  
  Step6: Move block with index 13  (place the first orange wedge as half of the roof)  
  Step7: Move block with index 14  (place the second orange wedge alongside to complete the roof)  
}

Following these steps will yield the exact same structure as in the target image without rotating any pieces beyond how they appear in the dictionary.
